page.title: 01Ashton-under-Lyne.
page.content: Ashton-under-Lyne is part of the Greater Manchester Metropolitan Borough of Tameside, situated to the east of Manchester on the north bank of the river Tame. It is an old market town (St. Michael's Parish Church is mentioned in the first Domesday Survey) which grew considerably during the industrial revolution due to cotton. The town name derives from the Assheton family who owned the manor during the 14th century; under-Lyne comes from the Pennine uplands area which was once known as Lyme. The following 19 pages were produced by children from 8 different Primary schools within the Ashton Area and are intended to portray a flavour of life in our town today.
